page.title: 18ENTERTAINMENT IN HORLEY
page.content: Horley has its own theatre club formed July 1952 by Horley Central Players. The Archway Theatre Club was located in the middle railway arch. After a short closure, the theatre was extended to cover three arches. The Barts Players also perform here. Both groups produce up to ten plays each year. The number of performances has grown recently because of a greater demand for tickets and only members of the club may purchase tickets for themselves and guests. They have their own bar. Productions are sponsored by outside groups. Horley had one cinema "The Regent" until July 1982. It was situated in Victoria Road but was demolished to allow for further development next to Waitrose super market. Once a larger cinema, it had been converted to provide Bingo downstairs and a cinema upstairs.
